channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Autism rates have soared. This doctor says he knows part of the reason why
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Dr. Allen Frances, about his piece in the New York Times titled, "Autism Rates have Increased 60-Fold. I Played a Role in That."

item.title: 10 years after same-sex marriage was legalized, evangelicals still work to oppose it
item.description: In the 10 years since the legalization of same-sex marriage across the U.S., religious support for the right has increased significantly. But opposition among some religious groups persists.

item.title: Former first lady Michelle Obama on saying 'no' more often
item.description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama says she's starting a new chapter of her life where she's saying "no" more often. It comes as she reassesses her priorities in life after her mother's death.

item.title: The legal battle over the fate of 23andMe's DNA data has taken a new twist
item.description: Genetic testing company 23andMe never hit on a sustainable business model and went bankrupt. Now, it's being sold to a non-profit launched by the co-founder, delaying addressing data privacy concerns.

item.title: Trump says anti-bribery laws are crippling U.S. businesses, so he's changing the rules
item.description: President Trump has said anti-corruption law is crippling American businesses. Since taking office, his administration has reduced the number of investigators, killed some cases and changed the rules.

item.title: As Iran and Israel fought, people turned to AI for facts. They didn't find many
item.description: AI-generated videos of fighting between Iran and Israel went viral, and people asked chatbots if they were real. "What we're seeing is AI mediating the experience of warfare," said one researcher.

item.title: Amid extreme heat, some power grids may struggle to keep up with rising energy demand
item.description: As extreme heat grips much of the country, some power grids may struggle to keep up with rising energy demand. But that is not the only challenge grid operators face in this heatwave.

item.title: Combative Pentagon news conference offers some new details on Iran nuclear strike
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has defended the U.S. airstrikes on Iranian nuclear sites, saying the attacks were the most complex and secretive military operation in history.

item.title: In 'F1,' Brad Pitt is in the driver's seat
item.description: Brad Pitt stars in F1, a film about a Formula One racing team from the director of Top Gun: Maverick.

item.title: As California's gray wolf population grows, so do conflicts with ranchers
item.description: California has seen its Gray Wolf population grow quickly over the last decade. Now, ranchers say the wolves are killing and stressing their livestock. They advocate for more options to ward them off.
